BP_Bug_BeeR_C.name: Golden Glory Bee
BP_Bug_BeeR_C.description:
A rare bee, imported from the Akwindu province. Mead made from this bee's honey is said to be heavily consumed by the Queen of the province and her family.
Has a chance to be found when chopping trees in Kilima during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_BeetleC_C.name: Spotted Stinkbug
BP_Bug_BeetleC_C.description:
A bug known more for his strong musk than its striking colors.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_BeetleE_C.name: Ancient Amber Beetle
BP_Bug_BeetleE_C.description:
One of the oldest known insects species in Palia, was said to exist in the time of humans.
Found in the forests of Bahari Bay. Also has a chance to be found when chopping trees in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_BeetleR_C.name: Raspberry Beetle
BP_Bug_BeetleR_C.description:
A beetle whose entire diet consists of raspberries.
Found around Badruu's Farm in Kilima.

BP_Bug_BeetleU_C.name: Proudhorned Stag Beetle
BP_Bug_BeetleU_C.description:
The horns of this stag beetle are said to resemble that of the Proudhorned Sernuk.
Has a chance to be found when mining in Kilima.

BP_Bug_BeeU_C.name: Bahari Bee
BP_Bug_BeeU_C.description:
A local species of bees, known to produce delicious honey.
Has a chance to be found when chopping trees in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_ButterflyC_C.name: Common Blue Butterfly
BP_Bug_ButterflyC_C.description:
Ever resilient. Butterflies of this type can be found in almost every climate in Palia.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_ButterflyE_C.name: Rainbow-tipped Butterfly
BP_Bug_ButterflyE_C.description:
Ancient legends say this rare butterfly got its beautiful coloring from dipping the tip of its wings in a Well of Flow.
Found in the Fields of Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_ButterflyR_C.name: Brighteye Butterfly
BP_Bug_ButterflyR_C.description:
Whenever you see the sun out, you can see the eyes of this intricately patterned butterfly looking around Bahari Bay.
Found in the Forests of Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_ButterflyU_C.name: Duskwing Butterfly
BP_Bug_ButterflyU_C.description:
A beautiful butterfly with wings the color of dusk. Unique to the Kilima Valley.
Found around the Dragon Shrine in Kilima during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_CicadaC_C.name: Common Bark Cicada
BP_Bug_CicadaC_C.description:
A common cicada.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_CicadaR_C.name: Spitfire Cicada
BP_Bug_CicadaR_C.description:
A spirited cicada, whose bark is worse than its bite.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_CicadaU_C.name: Cerulean Cicada
BP_Bug_CicadaU_C.description:
The call of this cicada is so soothing, it was said to be the inspiration for Ayana's fourth symphony.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

BP_Bug_CrabC_C.name: Bahari Crab
BP_Bug_CrabC_C.description:
A local crab, known to taste good with drawn butter.
Found along the coast of Bahari Bay. Also has a chance to be found when foraging shells in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_CrabR_C.name: Vampire Crab
BP_Bug_CrabR_C.description:
An invasive species of crab that sucks the life out of the local population.
Found around the Flooded Fortress in Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_CrabU_C.name: Spineshell Crab
BP_Bug_CrabU_C.description:
A crab with a very spiny shell.
Found along the coast of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_CricketC_C.name: Common Field Cricket
BP_Bug_CricketC_C.description:
Field crickets can be found anywhere you can find a field.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_CricketR_C.name: Azure Stonehopper
BP_Bug_CricketR_C.description:
This little blue beauty has been known to camouflage itself as a shiny blue pebble.
Found in the fields of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_CricketU_C.name: Garden Leafhopper
BP_Bug_CricketU_C.description:
The Garden Leafhopper is such a delight in Palia that many children keep them as pets. They are said to bring good luck.
Found in the fields and Badruu's Farm in Kilima. Also has a chance to be found when foraging in Kilima.

BP_Bug_DragonflyC_C.name: Brushtail Dragonfly
BP_Bug_DragonflyC_C.description:
The tail of this Dragonfly is so bright and vibrant, some early Majiri were said to have used it as a paintbrush.
Found around the lake in Kilima, as well as rivers and ponds in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_DragonflyE_C.name: Jewelwing Dragonfly
BP_Bug_DragonflyE_C.description:
A Dragonfly with wings as bright and colorful as any precious stone.
Found near a cave entrance on a cliff in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_DragonflyR_C.name: Firebreathing Dragonfly
BP_Bug_DragonflyR_C.description:
This Dragonfly is notoriously difficult to catch, in part due to its fiery breath.
Found in the fields of Kilima.

BP_Bug_DragonflyU_C.name: Inky Dragonfly
BP_Bug_DragonflyU_C.description:
This stealthy Dragonfly is used as a component in various black dyes and inks.
Found around rivers and ponds in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_GlowbugC_C.name: Paper Lantern Bug
BP_Bug_GlowbugC_C.description:
This bug glows as brightly as a colorful feast day lantern taking flight into the Palian night sky.
Found along the coast and in forests of Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_GlowbugR_C.name: Bahari Glowbug
BP_Bug_GlowbugR_C.description:
A local species of bioluminescent fauna. Discovered by Professor Bonlin Amepongo.
Found in the fields of Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_LadybugR_C.name: Princess Ladybug
BP_Bug_LadybugR_C.description:
A very regal looking lady bug, made popular by the children's fairytale, The Princess Who Turned Into A Ladybug.
Found around the lake in Kilima.

BP_Bug_LadybugU_C.name: Garden Ladybug
BP_Bug_LadybugU_C.description:
A black and red ladybug, popular for controlling garden pests.
Has a chance to be found when foraging in the fields of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_MantisE_C.name: Fairy Mantis
BP_Bug_MantisE_C.description:
A mantis from early Majiri legend only recently confirmed to exist by modern entomologists. Said to have magical properties.
Found in the fields of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_MantisR1_C.name: Spotted Mantis
BP_Bug_MantisR1_C.description:
A rare mantis with a beautiful set of spots.
Found around the Dragon Shrine in Kilima.

BP_Bug_MantisR2_C.name: Leafstalker Mantis
BP_Bug_MantisR2_C.description:
An herbivorous mantis that exclusively eats leaves.
Has a chance to be found when foraging in the forests of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_MantisU_C.name: Garden Mantis
BP_Bug_MantisU_C.description:
Nothing to see here. Just your garden variety mantis.
Found around the lake in Kilima. Also has a chance to be found when foraging around the lake in Kilima.

BP_Bug_MothC_C.name: Kilima Night Moth
BP_Bug_MothC_C.description:
While beautiful, the Kilima night moth is so prevalent on hot summer nights that some consider it to be a pest. Keep away from stored cloth.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_MothR_C.name: Gossamer Veil Moth
BP_Bug_MothR_C.description:
The wings of this moth are so thin that some say you can see a peek of the Dragon Realm by looking through them.
Found in the fields of Kilima during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_MothU_C.name: Lunar Fairy Moth
BP_Bug_MothU_C.description:
The Lunar Fairy Moth is said to have a very special connection to the Dragon Moon, and is said to only appear at special times during its cycle.
Found in the fields and forests of Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

BP_Bug_PedeR1_C.name: Hairy Millipede
BP_Bug_PedeR1_C.description:
A millipede with a hair growth problem.
Found in the forests of Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_PedeR2_C.name: Scintillating Centipede
BP_Bug_PedeR2_C.description:
A rare centipede with a shiny hard shell.
Has a chance to be found when mining in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_PedeU_C.name: Garden Millipede
BP_Bug_PedeU_C.description:
A brown and green millipede that loves feasting on garden crops.
Found in the fields of Kilima. Also has a chance to be found when foraging in the fields of Kilima.

BP_Bug_SnailR_C.name: Stripeshell Snail
BP_Bug_SnailR_C.description:
A snail with such distinctive stripes, that its shell was once used as currency among the early Majiri.
Found along the coast in Bahari Bay.

BP_Bug_SnailU_C.name: Garden Snail
BP_Bug_SnailU_C.description:
A snail that has evolved over time to look like a leaf. Good for hiding from predators, bad for hiding from the Leafstalker Mantis.
Found along the coast and in forests of Bahari Bay.

BP_Coral_C.name: Coral
BP_Coral_C.description: Bring the beach home with you with this piece of coral. You can almost smell the reef!

BP_Fish_AlbinoEeel_C.name: Albino Eel
BP_Fish_AlbinoEeel_C.description:
An eel with no pigmentation.
Found in Bahari Bay caves using worms.

BP_Fish_Alligator_Gar_C.name: Alligator Gar
BP_Fish_Alligator_Gar_C.description:
A carnivorous fish with brilliant purple scales, the Alligator Gar is named after its long snout and rows of large teeth.
Found in Kilima Lake using glow worms.

BP_Fish_AncientFish_C.name: Ancient Fish
BP_Fish_AncientFish_C.description: hese fish are as old as the continent of Palia itself, and were thought to be extinct. Guess you have something in common.

BP_Fish_Bahari_Pike_C.name: Bahari Pike
BP_Fish_Bahari_Pike_C.description:
A pike with a deep green hue native to Bahari Bay.
Found in Bahari rivers using glow worms.

BP_Fish_BahariBream_C.name: Bahari Bream
BP_Fish_BahariBream_C.description:
These fish are widely considered to be a staple of the local diet.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using worms.

BP_Fish_Barracuda_C.name: Barracuda
BP_Fish_Barracuda_C.description:
A vicious saltwater predator that tastes great lightly grilled with a little butter.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay without bait in the evening and night.

BP_Fish_BatRay_C.name: Bat Ray
BP_Fish_BatRay_C.description:
An ominous ray that is known to leap out of the water like a flying bat.
Found in Bahari Bay caves using worms.

BP_Fish_Beluga_Sturgeon_C.name: Beluga Sturgeon
BP_Fish_Beluga_Sturgeon_C.description:
A large sturgeon that grows throughout its entire lifetime.
Found in Kilima Lake using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Bigeye_Tuna_C.name: Bluefin Tuna
BP_Fish_Bigeye_Tuna_C.description:
A common, sleek fish adapted for swimming quickly through ocean currents.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using worms.

BP_Fish_Black_Sea_Bass_C.name: Black Sea Bass
BP_Fish_Black_Sea_Bass_C.description:
Known for the black spots on their skin, these bass are gentle and non-threatening to Majiri and humans alike.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Blobfish_C.name: Blobfish
BP_Fish_Blobfish_C.description:
A bloated, slimy fish that lives at the bottom of cavern pools.
Found in Bahari Bay caves using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Blue_Spotted_Ray_C.name: Blue Spotted Ray
BP_Fish_Blue_Spotted_Ray_C.description:
A colorful stringray with bright blue spots across its body and blue stripes along its tail.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using glow worms in the morning, day, and evening.

BP_Fish_BlueMarlin_C.name: Blue Marlin
BP_Fish_BlueMarlin_C.description:
A large and resilient fish. The Blue Marlin is considered a prize by even the most experienced fishermen.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using worms.

BP_Fish_Cactus_Moray_C.name: Cactus Moray
BP_Fish_Cactus_Moray_C.description:
An eel with sharp spines growing along its length to deter predators.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using glow worms in the day and night.

BP_Fish_CalicoKoi_C.name: Calico Koi
BP_Fish_CalicoKoi_C.description:
A standard koi fish with a beautiful calico pattern.
Found in ponds without using any bait.

BP_Fish_CantankerousKoi_C.name: Cantankerous Koi
BP_Fish_CantankerousKoi_C.description:
Local legend has it that the first Cantankerous Koi was a cranky old man transfigured by a wicked witch.
Found in ponds without using any bait during the day and at night.

BP_Fish_Channel_Catfish_C.name: Channel Catfish
BP_Fish_Channel_Catfish_C.description:
A river catfish at home navigating fast currents.
Found in Kilima Rivers without bait.

BP_Fish_Chub_C.name: Chub
BP_Fish_Chub_C.description:
A hard-fighting fish famous for its wide ranging appetite.
Found in Bahari rivers using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Cloudfish_C.name: Cloudfish
BP_Fish_Cloudfish_C.description:
A bottom feeding pondfish that creates swirling clouds of sediment for cover.
Found in ponds using glow worms in the morning and day.

BP_Fish_Codfish_C.name: Bahari Bass
BP_Fish_Codfish_C.description:
A bountiful, staple fish known for its mild flavor.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay without bait.

BP_Fish_Crimson_Fangtooth_C.name: Crimson Fangtooth
BP_Fish_Crimson_Fangtooth_C.description:
A small red fish with huge teeth in proportion to its own size.
Found in Bahari Bay caves using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Crucian_Carp_C.name: Crucian Carp
BP_Fish_Crucian_Carp_C.description:
A hardy carp with coppery golden scales.
Found in Kilima rivers using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Cutthroat_Trout_C.name: Cutthroat Trout
BP_Fish_Cutthroat_Trout_C.description:
A river trout named after its long jaw and mouth.
Found in Bahari Bay rivers using worms.

BP_Fish_Dawnray_C.name: Dawnray
BP_Fish_Dawnray_C.description:
A golden ray that hunts at dawn, its scales absorbing the sun's light.
Found in Bahari Rivers without bait in the morning.

BP_Fish_Duskray_C.name: Duskray
BP_Fish_Duskray_C.description:
A mottled charcoal ray that hunts at dusk, blending into the riverbed.
Found in Bahari Rivers without bait in the evening.

BP_Fish_Enchanted_Pupfish_C.name: Enchanted Pupfish
BP_Fish_Enchanted_Pupfish_C.description:
A cute little fish which can absorb trace amounts of Flow into its scales.
Found in Kilima Lake using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Energized_Piranha_C.name: Energized Piranha
BP_Fish_Energized_Piranha_C.description:
A pirhana infused with magic after consuming a Grimalkin magic trinket.
Found in Kilima Rivers using worms.

BP_Fish_EyelessMinnow_C.name: Eyeless Minnow
BP_Fish_EyelessMinnow_C.description:
A cave dwelling creature that has lost the need for eyes.
Found in Bahari Bay caves without bait.

BP_Fish_FairyCarp_C.name: Fairy Carp
BP_Fish_FairyCarp_C.description:
A shy fish with a hypnotically translucent sheen.
Found in ponds using worms in the mornings and evenings.

BP_Fish_Fathead_Minnow_C.name: Fathead Minnow
BP_Fish_Fathead_Minnow_C.description:
A small freshwater fish known for its oversized head.
Found in Bahari rivers using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Flametongue_Ray_C.name: Flametongue Ray
BP_Fish_Flametongue_Ray_C.description:
A rare river ray named for the bright orange and red streaks across its back.
Found in Kilima rivers using glow worms in the morning and day.

BP_Fish_FreshwaterEel_C.name: Freshwater Eel
BP_Fish_FreshwaterEel_C.description:
A long and lithe river fish often confused for a snake.
Found in Kilima Rivers using worms in the evening and night.

BP_Fish_Giant_Goldfish_C.name: Giant Goldfish
BP_Fish_Giant_Goldfish_C.description:
Against all odds, some goldfish live to become legendary in size.
Found in ponds using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Giant_Kilima_Stingray_C.name: Giant Kilima Stingray
BP_Fish_Giant_Kilima_Stingray_C.description:
The lord of Kilima Lake, this stingray's poisonous spike can also pierce the bones of its prey.
Found in Kilima Lake using glow worms in the morning, day, and evening.

BP_Fish_Gillyfin_C.name: Gillyfin
BP_Fish_Gillyfin_C.description:
The most common fish in Palia.
Found in Kilima Lake without using bait.

BP_Fish_GoldenSalmon_C.name: Golden Salmon
BP_Fish_GoldenSalmon_C.description:
A common sort of salmon known to thrive in the sunlight.
Found in Kilima Rivers using worms in the morning and day.

BP_Fish_Honey_Loach_C.name: Honey Loach
BP_Fish_Honey_Loach_C.description:
A river fish whose yellow and black stripes resemble a honeybee.
Found in Bahari rivers using glow worms at day and night.

BP_Fish_Hypnotic_Moray_C.name: Hypnotic Moray
BP_Fish_Hypnotic_Moray_C.description:
A moray eel that combines its striking pattern and hypnotic movements to lure in prey.
Found in Bahari Bay caves using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Indigo_Lamprey_C.name: Indigo Lamprey
BP_Fish_Indigo_Lamprey_C.description:
Palians in the past would harvest the scales of this fish to make a deep indigo dye.
Found in Kilima rivers using glow worms in the evening and night.

BP_Fish_Kenjis_Carp_C.name: Kenli's Carp
BP_Fish_Kenjis_Carp_C.description:
Kenli personally discovered this carp near Kilima Village. Bears a remarkable resemblance to a Crucian Carp...
Found in Kilima rivers using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Kilima_Grayling_C.name: Kilima Grayling
BP_Fish_Kilima_Grayling_C.description:
A streamlined fish that spends the first part of its life at sea before returning to the rivers of the Kilima Valley.
Found in Kilima rivers using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Kilima_Redfin_C.name: Kilima Redfin
BP_Fish_Kilima_Redfin_C.description:
An aggressive river predator that will eat literally anything.
Found in Bahari Bay rivers using worms.

BP_Fish_KilimaCatFish_C.name: Kilima Catfish
BP_Fish_KilimaCatFish_C.description:
A unique type of catfish found only in the Kilima Valley.
Found in ponds using worms.

BP_Fish_LargemouthBass_C.name: Largemouth Bass
BP_Fish_LargemouthBass_C.description:
A very talkative bass that can swallow creatures over 50% their own body weight.
Found in Kilima Lake using worms.

BP_Fish_Midnight_Paddlefish_C.name: Midnight Paddlefish
BP_Fish_Midnight_Paddlefish_C.description:
A rare paddlefish that feeds at night, its dark scales keeping it hidden from predators.
Found in Kilima Lake using glow worms at night.

BP_Fish_Mirror_Carp_C.name: Mirror Carp
BP_Fish_Mirror_Carp_C.description:
A silvery carp with scales resembling mirrors.
Found in ponds using worms.

BP_Fish_Mottled_Gobi_C.name: Mottled Gobi
BP_Fish_Mottled_Gobi_C.description:
An under appreciated fish that feeds on excess pond algae.
Found in ponds using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Mudminnow_C.name: Mudminnow
BP_Fish_Mudminnow_C.description:
A common minnow known for its muddy looking color.
Found in ponds without using any bait.

BP_Fish_MutatedAngler_C.name: Mutated Angler
BP_Fish_MutatedAngler_C.description:
A terrifying monstrosity, said to be a survivor from the time of humans.
Found in Bahari Bay caves using worms.

BP_Fish_Oily_Anchovy_C.name: Oily Anchovy
BP_Fish_Oily_Anchovy_C.description:
A slimy fish some Majiri find strangely appetizing.
Found in Bahari Bay rivers using worms.

BP_Fish_Orange_Bluegill_C.name: Orange Bluegill
BP_Fish_Orange_Bluegill_C.description:
An omnivorous fish that prefers insects but will eat anything it can fit into its mouth.
Found in ponds using worms.

BP_Fish_Paddlefish_C.name: Paddlefish
BP_Fish_Paddlefish_C.description:
A primitive fish that has survived for millions of years.
Found in Bahari Bay rivers using worms in the morning, day, and evening.

BP_Fish_PaintedPerch_C.name: Painted Perch
BP_Fish_PaintedPerch_C.description:
A petite river fish known for its pleasing colors.
Found in Kilima Lake using worms.

BP_Fish_Platinum_Chad_C.name: Platinum Chad
BP_Fish_Platinum_Chad_C.description:
The brilliant platinum scales of this chad can fool fishermen into dreams of wealth.
Found in Kilima rivers using glow worms.

BP_Fish_PrismTrout_C.name: Prism Trout
BP_Fish_PrismTrout_C.description:
A gorgeous trout that shines like rainbows in the sunlight.
Found in Kilima Lake using worms in the morning and day.

BP_Fish_RadiantSunfish_C.name: Radiant Sunfish
BP_Fish_RadiantSunfish_C.description:
A beautifully radiant river fish that emits a blinding ray of light many compare to looking directly into the sun.
Found in Kilima Rivers using worms.

BP_Fish_Rainbow_Trout_C.name: Rainbow Trout
BP_Fish_Rainbow_Trout_C.description:
A river fish sporting a muted multicolor scale pattern.  Not smart enough to be jealous of the Prism Trout.
Found in Kilima Rivers without bait.

BP_Fish_Red-bellied_piranha_C.name: Red-bellied Piranha
BP_Fish_Red-bellied_piranha_C.description:
An aggressive river predator that will eat literally anything.
Found in Kilima Rivers using worms.

BP_Fish_RibbontailRay_C.name: Ribbontail Ray
BP_Fish_RibbontailRay_C.description:
Known to frequent tropical waters, the Ribbon Tail Ray recently made a surprising migration from the isles of Inyrevn to the west coast of the Palian Republic.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using worms in the morning and evening.

BP_Fish_Rosy_Bitterling_C.name: Rosy Bitterling
BP_Fish_Rosy_Bitterling_C.description:
A freshwater fish with a rosy patch on its behind.
Found in Bahari Rivers without bait.

BP_Fish_Sardine_C.name: Sardine
BP_Fish_Sardine_C.description:
A small, but quick foraging fish that many Majiri enjoy eating when pickled.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay without bait.

BP_Fish_Scarlet_Koi_C.name: Scarlet Koi
BP_Fish_Scarlet_Koi_C.description:
A sleek koi fish with a deep red pattern.
Found in ponds using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Shimmerfin_C.name: Shimmerfin
BP_Fish_Shimmerfin_C.description:
A mysterious fish that can sometimes be in two places at once.
Found in Kilima Lake using worms.

BP_Fish_SilverSalmon_C.name: Silver Salmon
BP_Fish_SilverSalmon_C.description:
A common silvery fish.
Found in Kilima Rivers without bait in evenings and nights.

BP_Fish_Silvery_Minnow_C.name: Silvery Minnow
BP_Fish_Silvery_Minnow_C.description:
A common minnow with silvery scales that sparkle in the sun.
Found in Bahari Rivers without bait.

BP_Fish_SmallmouthBass_C.name: Smallmouth Bass
BP_Fish_SmallmouthBass_C.description:
A common bass with very little to say that is known to occasionally leap from the water.
Found in Kilima Lake using worms.

BP_Fish_SpottedBullhead_C.name: Spotted Bullhead
BP_Fish_SpottedBullhead_C.description:
A bullhead with a spotted pattern.
Found in Kilima Rivers without bait.

BP_Fish_Stalking_Catfish_C.name: Stalking Catfish
BP_Fish_Stalking_Catfish_C.description:
A predatory blue catfish that will attack nearby vulnerable fish.
Found in ponds using glow worms in the evening and night.

BP_Fish_Stickleback_C.name: Stickleback
BP_Fish_Stickleback_C.description:
A carnivorous fish that enjoys feasting on roe, insects, crustaceans, and the toes of fisherman.
Found in Kilima Rivers using worms in the morning and day.

BP_Fish_Stonefish_C.name: Stonefish
BP_Fish_Stonefish_C.description:
Extremely poisonous, Stonefish naturally blend into their surroundings while waiting for prey.
Found in Bahari Bay caves using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Stormray_C.name: Stormray
BP_Fish_Stormray_C.description:
A majestic river ray that hunts by twisting water currents and channeling lightning through its tail.
Found in Bahari rivers using glow worms in the morning and evening.

BP_Fish_Striped_Dace_C.name: Striped Dace
BP_Fish_Striped_Dace_C.description:
A dace with a striped pattern down its back.
Found in Kilima Rivers without bait.

BP_Fish_StripedSturgeon_C.name: Striped Sturgeon
BP_Fish_StripedSturgeon_C.description:
A bottom feeding lake fish with light colored stripes that allow it to camouflage in the sunlight.
Found in Kilima Lake using worms in the evening and night.

BP_Fish_Swordfin_Eel_C.name: Swordfin Eel
BP_Fish_Swordfin_Eel_C.description:
An apex predator eel that uses its own body to cut down prey.
Found in Bahari rivers using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Thundering_Eel_C.name: Thundering Eel
BP_Fish_Thundering_Eel_C.description:
An electrically charged eel that can shock its prey into submission.
Found in Bahari Bay rivers using worms.

BP_Fish_UmbranCarp_C.name: Umbran Carp
BP_Fish_UmbranCarp_C.description:
A relative of the Fairy Carp, the Umbran Carp prefers the dark environments of caves and underground lake systems.
Found in Bahari Bay caves without bait.

BP_Fish_UnicornFish_C.name: Long Nosed Unicorn Fish
BP_Fish_UnicornFish_C.description:
The horn of the unicorn fish is valuable to any alchemist or potion master. But beware, they are rumored to have psychic abilities that can make even the most accomplished fisherman think left is right.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using glow worms during the day.

BP_Fish_Voidray_C.name: Void Ray
BP_Fish_Voidray_C.description:
Alien and terrifying, some say the Voidray can enter the Echo realm and feed off smaller echoes it finds.
Found in Bahari Bay caves using glow worms.

BP_Fish_Willow_Lamprey_C.name: Willow Lamprey
BP_Fish_Willow_Lamprey_C.description:
A long, thin lamprey named after its similarity to the branches of a willow tree.
Found in Bahari Bay rivers using worms at night.

BP_Fish_Yellow_Perch_C.name: Yellow Perch
BP_Fish_Yellow_Perch_C.description:
A common perch found in rivers.
Found in Bahari Rivers without bait.

BP_Fish_Yellowfin_Tuna_C.name: Yellowfin Tuna
BP_Fish_Yellowfin_Tuna_C.description:
A large tuna that can swim faster than its size implies.
Found off the coast of Bahari Bay using glow worms.

BP_FishingJackpot_C.name: Waterlogged Chest
BP_FishingJackpot_C.description: Open this mysterious chest to receive the prize inside.

BP_FishingRecipeBook_C.name: Recipe: Fish Stew
BP_FishingRecipeBook_C.description: Consume to learn the recipe for making Fish Stew.

BP_Gatherable_MushroomBlue_C.name: Brightshroom
BP_Gatherable_MushroomBlue_C.description: Brightshrooms get their glow from absorbing Flow and thus have many alchemical uses.

BP_Gatherable_MushroomR_C.name: Mountain Morel
BP_Gatherable_MushroomR_C.description: A common mushroom, Mountain Morels can be found right at home! Super popular, raw or cooked.

BP_HeartdropLilly_C.name: Heartdrop Lily
BP_HeartdropLilly_C.description: The Heartdrop Lily is a rare flower with a special meaning to Palians: the blossoming of romantic love.

BP_Mining_Clay_C.name: Clay
BP_Mining_Clay_C.description: An earthen material. Can be smelted into ceramic for crafting.

BP_Mining_Copper_Large_C.name: Copper Ore (L)
BP_Mining_Copper_Large_C.description: A rock that contains copper. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Copper_Medium_C.name: Copper Ore (M)
BP_Mining_Copper_Medium_C.description: A rock that contains copper. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Copper_Small_C.name: Copper Ore (S)
BP_Mining_Copper_Small_C.description: A rock that contains copper. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Iron_Large_C.name: Iron Ore (L)
BP_Mining_Iron_Large_C.description: A rock that contains iron. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Iron_Medium_C.name: Iron Ore (M)
BP_Mining_Iron_Medium_C.description: A rock that contains iron. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Iron_Small_C.name: Iron Ore (S)
BP_Mining_Iron_Small_C.description: A rock that contains iron. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Palium_Large_C.name: Palium Ore (L)
BP_Mining_Palium_Large_C.description: A rock that contains palium. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Palium_Medium_C.name: Palium Ore (M)
BP_Mining_Palium_Medium_C.description: A rock that contains palium. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Palium_Small_C.name: Palium Ore (S)
BP_Mining_Palium_Small_C.description: A rock that contains palium. Can be smelted into bars for crafting.

BP_Mining_Stone_Large_C.name: Stone (L)
BP_Mining_Stone_Large_C.description: A common stone. Can be smelted into bricks.

BP_Moss_DragonsBeard_C.name: Dragon's Beard Peat
BP_Moss_DragonsBeard_C.description: Dragon's Beard Peat is a rare, alchemical, moss named for its color, which resembles Maji's.

BP_Moss_EmeraldCarpet_C.name: Emerald Carpet Moss
BP_Moss_EmeraldCarpet_C.description: Filling your home with the bright color of Emerald Carpet Moss is said to bring good luck.

BP_Oyster_C.name: Unopened Oyster
BP_Oyster_C.description: Open up this oyster! Even if you don't find a pearl, you can at least eat it.

BP_PoisonFlower_C.name: Briar Daisy
BP_PoisonFlower_C.description: The mountainous Briar Daisy can survive even the harshest conditions.

BP_QuestItem_CookBook_1_C.name: Fancy Cook Book
BP_QuestItem_CookBook_1_C.description: The book jacket reads, "Upper Crusts: A Guide to Cooking for Majiri Elite."

BP_QuestItem_CookBook_2_C.name: Dessert Cook Book
BP_QuestItem_CookBook_2_C.description: The book jacket reads, "Sweets for the Sweet: A Guide to Crafting Drool-Worthy Desserts."

BP_Seashell_C.name: Shell
BP_Seashell_C.description: Who sells sea shells by the sea shore? No one. You had to find this yourself.

BP_Spice_DariCloves_C.name: Dari Cloves
BP_Spice_DariCloves_C.description: The rare Dari Clove is a spice loved by chefs and alchemists alike. Said to have magical properties.

BP_Spice_HeatRoot_C.name: Heat Root
BP_Spice_HeatRoot_C.description: Don't sweat it! Whether it's cooking or healing, spicy Heat Root will warm you up from the inside out.

BP_Spiced_Sprouts_C.name: Spice Sprouts
BP_Spiced_Sprouts_C.description: Spice Sprouts will lend a rich color and earthy flavor to any dish. And they're pretty easy to find, too..

BP_SundropLillies_C.name: Sundrop Lily
BP_SundropLillies_C.description: The Sundrop Lily grows in open fields where it can turn its petals to the sunlight.

BP_SweetLeaves_C.name: Sweet Leaf
BP_SweetLeaves_C.description: Those with sweet teeth will love this Sweet Leaf, one of Palia's favorite dessert ingredients.

BP_Trash_Shipfragments_C.name: Ship Fragments
BP_Trash_Shipfragments_C.description: A common piece of garbage found in the ocean. Evidence of a recent shipwreck.

BP_Trash_Wagonwheel_C.name: Wagon Wheel
BP_Trash_Wagonwheel_C.description: A common piece of garbage found in and around Crystal Lake. Perhaps a relic from travelers passing through.

BP_Trash_WaterloggedBoot_C.name: Waterlogged Boot
BP_Trash_WaterloggedBoot_C.description: A common piece of garbage found in Mirror Pond.

BP_WaterFlower_C.name: Crystal Lake Lotus
BP_WaterFlower_C.description: The Crystal Lake Lotus is named after where it was discovered and is now used to make dyes.

BP_WildGarlic_C.name: Wild Garlic
BP_WildGarlic_C.description: Garlic is a delicious addition to any dish you cook! Or can be eaten raw to perfume one's breath.
